title: Sims 4 Needs Cheats: Popular Tricks to Improve Gameplay

steps.title: Open the cheat console with Ctrl+⇧ Shift+C.
steps.content: Open the cheat console with Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + C . The Sims 4 has a built-in interface that lets you add cheats to your game—to pull it up , simply press the Ctrl , ⇧ Shift , and C keys at the same time. Once you do this, a text bar pops up in the top-left corner of your game screen. [1] X Research source Console version: Press both sets of trigger and bumper buttons simultaneously on your PlayStation or Xbox controller to pull up the cheat console. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Type testingcheats true to activate cheats in your game.
steps.content: Type testingcheats true to activate cheats in your game. Once you type in this code correctly, “Cheats are enabled” pops up beneath the text bar in the game. Be sure to write testingcheats as a single word and add a space before true —otherwise, cheats won’t be enabled. [3] X Research source This code is the same on PC, Mac, and console versions of The Sims 4 . Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + C to turn off the cheat console if you’re on PC or Mac, or press both trigger and bumper buttons together if you’re on console.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking to adjust your Sim’s needs with your mouse.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking to adjust your Sim’s needs with your mouse. Hover your mouse over the Sim you’d like to adjust—then press ⇧ Shift while clicking on them. A small menu of options pops up, including Make Happy and Cheat Need . Click on either Make Happy or the Disable Need Decay option in the Cheat Need submenu to automatically make your Sims’ needs full. [4] X Research source Console version: Press A + B (on Xbox) or ✕ + O (on PlayStation) while hovering over the Sim you’d like to adjust. In the menu that pops up, select Cheat Motive , followed by either Make Happy or Disable Motive Decay . [5] X Research source Make Happy makes your Sim’s needs full automatically, but they’ll eventually start to decay again. Use Disable Need Decay if you’d like your Sim’s needs to be full indefinitely. To turn your Sim’s needs back on, simply press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking on your Sim and then select Enable Needs Decay . [6] X Research source If you’re on console, press A + B (on Xbox) or ✕ + O (on PlayStation) while hovering over the Sim; then, select Enable Motive Decay from the Cheat Motive menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Type sims.fill_all_commodities to fill all of your Sims’ needs.
steps.content: Type sims.fill_all_commodities to fill all of your Sims’ needs. Enable cheats and type in sims.fill_all_commodities to make all of the Sims in your household happy. Once you hit Enter , your Sims’ needs will automatically go up. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking the mailbox to adjust an entire household’s needs.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking the mailbox to adjust an entire household’s needs. Adjust your game interface just beyond your Sims’ home to find the mailbox. After pressing ⇧ Shift and left-clicking this mailbox at the same time, click Disable Needs Decay to permanently fill your Sims’ needs. To put things back to normal, select Enable Needs Decay . [9] X Research source Console version: Hit A + B (on Xbox) or ✕ + O (on PlayStation) while hovering over the mailbox to pull up a separate menu. Hit Disable Needs Decay to keep your Sims’ needs full permanently (or Enable Needs Decay to turn this feature off again). The Make Happy option will fill up your Sims’ needs, but it won’t be permanent. This hack gives you the option to adjust either your household’s needs or the needs of your entire Sim universe. Choose wisely! [10] X Research source

steps.title: Give your household extra cash with kaching, rosebud, motherlode and Money X.
steps.content: Give your household extra cash with kaching , rosebud , motherlode and Money X . Enable cheats and type in kaching or rosebud to get 1,000 simoleons added to your in-game bank account, or motherlode to get 50,000. To add a larger amount of simoleons, type in the word Money followed by a numerical value (like Money 10,000,000 ). [11] X Research source

steps.title: Increase your Sims’ skill levels with stats.set_skill_level [skilltype] [1-10].
steps.content: Increase your Sims’ skill levels with stats.set_skill_level [skilltype] [1-10] . Enable cheats and type in stats.set_skill_level , followed by the name of the skill you’d like to level up and the level you’d like to set it at. For example, to max out a Sim’s writing skill, you’d type stats.set_skill_level Major_Writing 10 . [12] X Research source Most skills are written as Major , followed by an underscore, followed by the name of the skill (without any spaces). Major_Fishing , Major_Mischief , Major_VideoGaming , Major_Handiness , and Major_RocketScience are just a few skills that you can adjust for your Sim. To level up the fitness skill, use Skill_Fitness .

steps.title: Type bb.moveobjects on to move and place your items freely.
steps.content: Type bb.moveobjects on to move and place your items freely . By default, The Sims 4 doesn’t let you place objects that interfere with other structures (like walls and other objects). To remove this barrier, open up your cheat console and type in bb.moveobjects on . [13] X Research source Make sure that your game is “Build Mode” before you try out this cheat.

steps.title: Give your Sims a free home with FreeRealEstate On.
steps.content: Give your Sims a free home with FreeRealEstate On . Before moving your Sim household into a home, open up the cheat console and type in FreeRealEstate On . This cheat makes all residential Sims properties completely free, so you don’t have to burn through your hard-earned simoleons. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Make your Sims immortal with death.toggle true.
steps.content: Make your Sims immortal with death.toggle true . Worried about your Sim electrocuting themselves or getting eaten by a cowplant? Type death.toggle true into your cheat console to give your characters a new lease on life. [15] X Research source Similarly, you can also use death.toggle false , which makes it so your Sim can die multiple times. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Edit your Sims’ outfits later by pressing ⇧ Shift and left-clicking on Modify in CAS.
steps.content: Edit your Sims’ outfits later by pressing ⇧ Shift and left-clicking on Modify in CAS . Not happy with the outfit you picked out for your Sim? Simply press ⇧ Shift while left-clicking to pull up a submenu. On this menu, click Modify in CAS to pull up the “Create a Sim” page and modify your Sim . [17] X Research source Console version: Press A + B (on Xbox) or ✕ and O (on PlayStation) while hovering over the Sim. Then, hit “Modify in CAS” to visit the “Create a Sim” page. [18] X Research source If you’d like to adjust your Sim’s traits, type cas.fulleditmode before hitting the Modify in CAS option.

steps.title: Teleport your Sims with Teleport Me Here.
steps.content: Teleport your Sims with Teleport Me Here . With the cheat console open, click anywhere on the ground while holding ⇧ Shift . Then, select Teleport Me Here . Make sure you’re playing with the Sim you want to teleport. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Give your Sim a career boost with careers.promote X.
steps.content: Give your Sim a career boost with careers.promote X . Tired of helping your Sim climb the corporate ladder? Give them a leg up by cheating which level of their career they’re in. Simply open the cheat console and type careers.promote X , with “X” being the level you’d like them to be. [20] X Research source For example, if you want your Sim to be a level 8 Doctor, make sure they’re in the Doctor career, and then use the cheat careers.promote 8 . You can also add a career with careers.add_career X (with “X” being the career of choice), or retire a Sim with careers.retire X .

steps.title: Cheat a Sim’s relationship by putting two Sim names together in the cheat console.
steps.content: Cheat a Sim’s relationship by putting two Sim names together in the cheat console. You can make two Sims fall madly in love or be enemies in a matter of seconds. Simply open the cheat console and type in one of these cheats: [21] X Research source ModifyRelationship {First Sim’s Full Name} {Second Sim’s Full Name} 100 LTR_Friendship_Main : 100% positive friendship ModifyRelationship {First Sim’s Full Name} {Second Sim’s Full Name} -100 LTR_Friendship_Main : 100% negative friendship ModifyRelationship {First Sim’s Full Name} {Second Sim’s Full Name} 100 LTR_Romance_Main : 100% romance between two Sims ModifyRelationship {First Sim’s Full Name} {Second Sim’s Full Name} -100 LTR_Romance_Main : 100% negative romance between two Sims
